snippet: A federal court ruled in favor of March for Life, a secular nonprofit that argued religious-only exemptions to employer insurance requirements violated equal protection principles.
abstract: United States District Court Judge Richard J Leon rules employers do not need to give insurance coverage for contraception even if their objections are moral rather than religious; case involves group March for Life and turns on key aspect of the Affordable Care Act mandating contraception coverage.
lead_paragraph: A federal court ruled in favor of March for Life, a secular nonprofit that argued religious-only exemptions to employer insurance requirements violated equal protection principles.

headline.main: Judge Allows Moral, Not Just Religious, Contraception Exemptions
headline.print_headline: Judge Grants Moral Basis to Exempt Birth Control

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
